title: Jameela Jamil glitters in a chic studded suit at the 26th annual Elle Women in Hollywood celebration
text:
She went from from being a TV presenter with no acting experience to one of the stars of NBC's critically adored comedy The Good Place.

Jameela Jamil was among the glamorous attendees of Elle magazine's 26th annual Women in Hollywood celebration Monday night at the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills.

The 33–year–old actress was unmissable on the red carpet in an eye-catching glittery suit.

Leading lady: Jameela Jamil, 33, was among the glamorous attendees of Elle magazine's 26th annual Women in Hollywood celebration Monday night at the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills

Jameela arrived in a striking androgynous look featuring a suit covered head–to–toe in reflective metal studs.

Her black blazer included prominent peaked lapels, and she wore a black top underneath that highlighted her cleavage.

The activist and presenter paired her jacket with matching pants with flared slacks that mostly obscured her pointy silver heels.

Glowing: Jameela arrived in a striking androgynous look featuring a suit covered head–to–toe in reflective metal studs

Androgynous chic: Her black blazer included prominent peaked lapels, and she wore a black top underneath that highlighted her cleavage

Jameela's lustrous raven tresses glowed nearly as much as her reflective clothing and rested in loose waves over her shoulder.

She sported multiple rings on her fingers and long black earrings featuring multiple hoops and jeweled pendants.

The Misery Index host's face was elegantly made up, and she sported a sultry cat's eye design.

Smokey eye: The Misery Index host's face was elegantly made up, and she sported a sultry cat's eye design

Back in black: Jameela stopped on the red carpet to pose with Elle editor–in–chief Nina Garcia, who matched the actress with a low-cut black sequined gown

Jameela stopped on the red carpet to pose with Elle editor–in–chief Nina Garcia, who matched the actress with a low-cut black sequined gown.

Though it has been more than a year since the Time's Up movement was founded Jameela and many of the other celebrities attending the gala were dressed in all-black, a show of solidarity with the organization.

The movement was founded in the wake of widespread accusations of sexual harassment, sexual assault and rape against film producer Harvey Weinstein.

The accusations came shortly after a widespread pattern of sexual harassment was revealed against two Fox News stalwarts, host Bill O'Reilly and network chairman Roger Ailes, who died in 2017.

TV star: Jameela is currently featured in the principle cast of the fourth and final season of The Good Place, a comedy about a group of people trying to navigate their new existence in the afterlife

Jameela is currently featured in the principle cast of the fourth and final season of The Good Place, a comedy about a group of people trying to navigate their new existence in the afterlife.

Despite it being her first on-screen acting work, critics have highlighted her hilarious performance as a name-dropping former socialite.

She's better known in her native UK as a TV presenter, and she'll return to those skills for the upcoming TBS game show The Misery Index.

Jameela will be joined on the series by improv all-stars and contestants who will try to rank a variety of unpleasant real-life events on a 1–100 scale.
description: Jameela Jamil rocked an androgynous chic suit covered in glittering metal studs for Elle magazine's 26th annual Women in Hollywood celebration. She was joined by other leading ladies.
